jam.util
Class FileUtilities

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jam.util.FileUtilities
public class FileUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

AWT utility class for easy creation of file dialogs. Maintains a memory of the last file and directory used.

Author:
Dale Visser

setExtension

public static java.lang.String setExtension(java.lang.String fileName,
                                            java.lang.String extension,
                                            int mode)
                                     throws UtilException
Takes a file name and extension and makes the file name to have the extension. If the filename has no extension, the extension is appended. If it does have an extension, it is replaced. By extension, we mean the usual DOX/Unix filenaming convention:

filename.ext
where ext is usually three characters indicating filetype.

Parameters:
fileName - with or without an extension already
extension - file extension; everything up to any decimal is thrown away
mode - FORCE if force a change, APPEND_ONLY if only append and not replace, NO_CHANGE if ignore
Returns:
a filename with the desired extension
UtilException
